main event: A bright object was observed moving erratically in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on February 10, 1963. The object appeared as a 'ball of fire', changed course to the south, and then disappeared by fading from sight.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 3 minutes.
It appeared as bright as a star and would circle and go away, reappearing in the same location after a few moments.
The witnesses, two students, did not hear any sound from the object.
The nature of the object is unknown and no conclusion could be reached.
Another sighting of a similar object was reported by the same witnesses on a future occasion.
